content: Yeah, I was really blown away by the sheer number of famous works on display, including Monet's "Water Lilies" and Seurat's "A Sunday on La Grande Jatte". My sister, who's an art history major, was able to provide some great insights into the context and significance of the paintings, which really enhanced my appreciation of the art. Anyway, I was wondering if the museum offers any guided tours or audio guides for the Impressionist collection?
